desc: Need a 2D animated video, primarily black and white with limited use of color. storyboards have been created.Video will tell two stories side by side and finishes with the characters A & B meeting in the same frame.completed videos must be 250MB or less and in one of the following file types: MOV, MP4, or WMVCute simple outlines are preferred. Video will need an audio background to run the length of the animation. Audio should be melancholy in nature for story board scenes 1-5 and a more cheerful/hopeful tone for scenes 6-7Scene 1Person A is walking around their university feeling lonelyPerson B is standing in the bathroom mirror deciding whether or not to cut their hairScene 2Person A is is in class and sees another girl that she likesPerson B (now has short hair for the rest of the video) is in their closet  deciding whether or not to wear a dress or a suit jacketScene 3Person A is at dinner with friends who are all in relationships and feels left outPerson B is wearing the suit jacket and  is deciding which bathroom to go into (Male vs Female)Scene 4Person A is sad sitting on a park bench in the rain and watching other people walk by looking happyPerson B walks by Person A and notices that person A is similar herScene 5Person A is still sitting on the bench in the rainPerson B goes to an umbrella vendor to buy an umbrellaScene 6 (same screen now)Person A looks up shocked that she was noticed her while person B hands Person A the new umbrellaScene 7 (same screen)Person A and B sit happily as friends and talk in the rainThe umbrellas will be maroon colored #A01E5CThe red dots signify a rainbow heart that Person A, B and the street vendor have
title: 20-40 sec animation - split screen story

desc: OBJECTIVEThe objective of the creative is to be a “wow” factor – as the leading technology in this space similar to the entrance of the children’s hospital wall in Monash.- Creative needs to capture attention- Interactive element to it- Easily accessible – aiming for 5 - 10 seconds max of engagement (timed 4 steps is approx. 4 seconds)- Need to capture attention very quickly before the person transitions into the next space (3m length)TARGET AUDIENCE· Primary audience in the space will predominately be students between the ages of 17 – 50yrs.Foot traffic into the space into the foyer and is a transitional space as people enter and move into the building or to the reception staff· Secondary audience – teachers and non-teaching staff.· Tertiary audience – industry expert / media / government bodies / industry partnersCREATIVE IDEASBased on sensor trigger on person stepping into the space:1) Welcome message inviting the person into the spacea. Welcome to "x" buildingb. Map of the building – swipe in and out and zoom to specific areasc. Video of staff inviting to the spaced. TVCs triggered by moving into space – movement of arms could bring different videos into the space.2) Outline of the person walking past and then engagement of other people joining the persons outline à develops the theme of community (using the words coming out with all the course areas or themes e.g. health / nursing / aged care / pathology / childhood education3) Lifecycle > images from child (play time / blocks / fun and lots of colour) > hospital scenes nursing > aged care (older generation) > this piece needs to look vibrant and happy otherwise could really have a very morbid feel to it. (maybe the Darwin theory - monkey > man evolution map type of thing)4) Engagement with students in the area could be images of the community > kids / adults / students as kids.5) Body outline which layers > / skeleton / muscle map / vein and artery / organs ([url removed, login to view])6) colours pulse discs as walk into the area (if multiple people move into the space the pulses increase for all7) Human heat maps – this may not work based on the technology8) Touch technology – multi choice questions where the screen is touched to answer the q.Other ideas / moving parts – these require someone to stop and engage fully with the wall which may not work in this pace:- Trigger launches balls to bounce across the walls- Pathology and science experiments – filling test tubes- Cogs / ideas that are moving around – similar to the below image with icons from the health space – the movement of learningInspiration:[url removed, login to view][url removed, login to view][url removed, login to view]What is required:1) can each or any of the above 8 suggestions be achieved - provide examples of similar2) what do you require from us to make any of these happen, or can you do from end to end.3) estimated cost and time frame for each
title: Kinect Interactive wall - Full detail
